userreviews.userReview: A good synopsis for someone in the midst of reading the GN's. I read a majority of them a year or so ago, and although I enjoy the story overall, it really is disturbing at time. I have just plain forgotten so many characters because that is just the nature of the beast that is The Walking Dead. Kirkman has a habit of introducing and killing characters off on a GRR Martin scale. You just get to know someone, and bam! they're gone.

Profiles of all of the characters in the graphic novel series. I liked how it showed their death scenes. But it was repetitive at times and could've used better editing. Some characters were listed as living but then you find out they died just a few sentences down in their profile.
Grabbed this one right after the end of season 7.Can't believe a lot of them are long gone :(
Our Story So Far.

I'm not quite sure what to think about this one. I guess it's a good resource to have if you're reading the series and can't remember who is who. But it's not really a good one to read straight through, and it's not anything I'd want to own.

Un buen resumen de los personajes que han ido apareciendo durante todo el proceso de The Walking Dead. Según se aprecia irán repasándose todos los personajes por entregas; en la primera entrega tenemos a 20 personajes, listados por orden alfabético.Sirve como resumen, por si nos perdemos entre tantos personajes. Y también para poder ir recordando si viven o mueren. Podemos averiguar en cuántos número salen, qué papel juegan en cada una de las etapas de la historia, sus relaciones, etc.Me parece una buena idea.

I haven't read all the books that go with the companion just yet, but it is nice to flip through sometimes and just read about things from other books. I enjoy reminiscing about who died and who is still living but I don't look at pages of characters that I don't know or don't want to know about.I recommend this to readers who have read Walking Dead numbers 1 - 16.Rating: 5.7/10Parental Rating: 16+

This collection is very redundant and flows very poorly. I understand what the aim was and while technically it succeeds; there is no real need for this to exist. No new art, simple Wikipedia style passages and not much else.A lot of it repeats. Not only that but it does not paint a clear picture of the entire story. The entries too piecemeal. Even for fans, avoid.

I like this book between the comics because after some issues it sure got a bit confusing around characters.This book is great because it tells who's still alive and who died. It actually shows how many characters appeared in the comics already which was a higher number than I expected.Reading this guide gets a boring sometimes, so I read it in small parts in between the comics.

I thought it was going to be a guide on how to survive the apocalypse, when it was a guide to the characters. Nothing wrong with that, just not what I was in the mood for. It's probably very useful to have around, just to keep everyone straight while you're reading or watching.Library copy.

Very cool guide for Walking Dead fans. Had the majority of the named characters origins, status and departures.Only problem I saw with it was that Ron - Jessie and Pete's son from Alexandria, was marked as "living" when his "point of departure" was "devoured by walkers trying to escape alexandria".Buh?

This is a good supplement to the Walking Dead graphic novels. It details all the characters, dead and alive, who have been in the graphic novels. Don't read this before reading the graphic novels, or it'll spoil the endings of each novel.

Walking Dead comics tends to snuff your favorite character, when you do not expect it. It is helpful guide to the survivors and even if it is little spoilerish, it is must have if you are fan of Walking Dead. Zombies are dead so they are not included :P

An excellent resource and companion book to the main series of comics. Note - not to be read until the reader has finished Volume 14. This is very important as the guides give away valuable plot points and incidents that happen up to and including volume 14.
Buena guía de personajes, de algunos ni me acordaba.
While it's nice to have a reference for all the characters in the comic series, there was a lot of repetitive information given. Some characters were painful to get through because of this.
This survivor's guide chronicles all the characters appearing in the series...
Not really worth rating, but a good reference for when a new volume comes out.
it is a amazing book !!!
This is ball shit it won't let me read the go damn book
It's helpful if you are reading through the comics, but by itself it really isn't that interesting.
Continuous misspellings and printing errors make this collection seem rushed and sloppy. Overall, a good reference for the numerous characters introduced throughout the series.
Helpful guide to the characters if you're reading The Walking Dead over a long period and lose track of who's who.
this is very interesting :)
Helped me keep some of the minor characters straight. Got redundant after awhile.
im not a huge fan of these recap fanwhore collections but it was nice to remember people, and to see who could potentially show up again...
Sina really dropped the ball on this one. Riddled with typos, it was almost painful to read at times.
Great companion book to the comic series. Absolutely perfect resource for the time when you're thinking "I can't remember..."
sneaked a peek, glad to see it won't ruin show for me since there are a lot of differences
[the zombie horde breakthrough at Alexandria and Carl getting shot in the head. (hide spoiler)]

description: Everything you've ever wanted to know about the cast of The Walking Dead. The Survivor's Guide is a handy checklist of all the characters who have appeared in the series thus far, alive or dead. This series is a can't-miss supplement to the hit comic book series that is now a hit TV series on AMC!
title: The Walking Dead Survivors' Guide
